# Team Pitch Session

## Introduction
Today's session allows your group to showcase the opportunity you've selected through a formal pitch presentation. This exercise develops your ability to communicate ideas persuasively while demonstrating effective leadership distribution within your team.

## Learning Objectives
By the end of this session, you will be able to:
- Deliver a persuasive team presentation with clear role distribution
- Demonstrate collaborative leadership principles in action
- Respond effectively to questions about your proposal

## Pitch Structure
Each team will have 7-10 minutes to present their chosen opportunity, followed by 3-5 minutes of questions. Your pitch should clearly outline:
- The specific opportunity and its potential value
- Why your team is uniquely positioned to pursue it
- How leadership roles and responsibilities will be distributed
- Initial implementation strategy

## Team Preparation Guidelines
1. Assign specific speaking roles to each team member
2. Designate a team leader who will introduce the pitch and manage transitions
3. Allocate specialized roles based on individual strengths (research presenter, financial analyst, etc.)
4. Prepare visual aids that enhance your presentation
5. Rehearse your timing and transitions between speakers

## Success Tips
- **Time Management**: Practice with a timer to ensure you stay within the 7-10 minute window
- **Visual Support**: Use clear, uncluttered slides with key points (not full paragraphs)
- **Engagement**: Make eye contact and vary your vocal tone to maintain audience interest
- **Question Preparation**: Anticipate potential questions and prepare concise responses

## Assessment Criteria
Evaluators will assess both your opportunity analysis and how effectively your team demonstrates collaborative leadership principles, including:
- Equal participation from all team members
- Clear communication of ideas and supporting evidence
- Professional presentation style and organization
- Thoughtful responses to questions

Remember that this exercise simulates real-world professional scenarios where clear communication and team coordination are essential skills.
